meanings.definition: A curved sword with a sharp edge.
meanings.sent1: The warrior wielded a scimitar in battle.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of brave heroes using a scimitar to defeat dragons.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, he dressed as a pirate with a plastic scimitar.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp as a scimitar, cutting through his excuses.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the scimitar in the sunlight struck fear into their hearts.

meanings.definition: To cut or strike with a scimitar.
meanings.sent1: He tried to scimitar through the thick bushes in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The skilled swordsman knew how to scimitar with precision.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to scimitar her way through the cake at the party.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to scimitar through her defenses, revealing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The chef's knife moved swiftly, as if trying to scimitar through the vegetables.
